bugs.title: CVE-2021-35197 mediawiki: blocked users are able to purge pages impacting Integrity [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-35197 mediawiki: blocked users are able to purge pages impacting Integrity [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-35197 mediawiki: blocked users are able to purge pages impacting Integrity

long_desc.thetext:
In MediaWiki before 1.31.15, 1.32.x through 1.35.x before 1.35.3, and 1.36.x before 1.36.1, bots have certain unintended API access. When a bot account has a "sitewide block" applied, it is able to still "purge" pages through the MediaWiki Action API (which a "sitewide block" should have prevented).

References:

https://lists.wikimedia.org/hyperkitty/list/mediawiki-announce@lists.wikimedia.org/thread/YR3X4L2CPSEJVSY543AWEO65TD6APXHP/

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1980309]

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2021-35197

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)

# testing, stable

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

bugs.title: CVE-2021-31556 mediawiki: MWOAuthConsumerSubmitControl.php does not ensure that the length of an RSA key will fit in a MySQL blob [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-31556 mediawiki: MWOAuthConsumerSubmitControl.php does not ensure that the length of an RSA key will fit in a MySQL blob [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-31556 mediawiki: OAuth extension doesn't validate length of RSA key

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in the Oauth extension for MediaWiki through 1.35.2. MWOAuthConsumerSubmitControl.php does not ensure that the length of an RSA key will fit in a MySQL blob.

References:

https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T277380
https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/q/I13ff0350a9a0a3cd5ab3e1f82dd0d8d9c13cf9e9

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1995203]

None of the Red Hat products are affected by this vulnerability, as the Oauth extension is distributed separately for MediaWiki and not included by default in any Red Hat products. 
Patch / code changes can be found at the OAuth extension - https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/rEOAU420a837a2df4c1c61e7efe2c0ac952f548dde2a8

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2021-31556

bugs.title: CVE-2021-41798 mediawiki: Cross-site scripting (XSS) in Special:Search [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-41798 mediawiki: Cross-site scripting (XSS) in Special:Search [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-41798 mediawiki: Cross-site scripting (XSS) in Special:Search

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in Mediawiki before 1.31.16, 1.35.4 and 1.36.2. A cross-site scripting vulnerability in Special:Search may lead to remote code execution in the victim's browser via a malicious link.

References:

https://lists.wikimedia.org/hyperkitty/list/mediawiki-announce@lists.wikimedia.org/message/2IFS5CM2YV4VMSODPX3J2LFHKSEWVFV5/
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T285515
OSD notaffected per parent OCP.

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2021-41798

bugs.title: CVE-2021-41800 mediawiki: improper access restrictions in PoolCounter protection of Special:Contributions. [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-41800 mediawiki: improper access restrictions in PoolCounter protection of Special:Contributions. [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-41800 mediawiki: mishandled PoolCounter's protection may result DoS when visiting Special:Contributions.

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in Mediawiki before 1.31.16, 1.35.4 and 1.36.2. The call to $pager->getNumRows() itself triggers execution of the database query backing the page.

References:

https://lists.wikimedia.org/hyperkitty/list/mediawiki-announce@lists.wikimedia.org/message/2IFS5CM2YV4VMSODPX3J2LFHKSEWVFV5/

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the

bugs.title: CVE-2021-41799 mediawiki: ApiQueryBacklinks can cause a full table scan and as a result DoS [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-41799 mediawiki: ApiQueryBacklinks can cause a full table scan and as a result DoS [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-41799 mediawiki: ApiQueryBacklinks can cause a full table scan and as a result DoS

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in Mediawiki before 1.31.16, 1.35.4 and 1.36.2. An improper database query in ApiQueryBacklinks may lead to a full table scan leading to exposure of confidential information.

References:

https://lists.wikimedia.org/hyperkitty/list/mediawiki-announce@lists.wikimedia.org/message/2IFS5CM2YV4VMSODPX3J2LFHKSEWVFV5/
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T290379
OSD affected/ooss.

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2021-41799

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2010201]
